comment_text: Both do exactly the same thing.
Why does it matter? There are subtle differences that do not matter 99% of the time. Generally I prefer list(map(math.pow, range(1, 11), repeat(2))) but its mainly a matter of taste.
They are identical. Prefer the first alternative.
List comprehensions do not pre-allocated exactly the required memory. They essentially work like a for-loop with append, which overallocates
@TheFoom the second o e has nothing to do with lambda, it is a generator expression that gets materialized into a list
